job_descriptions: Introducing Tookitaki  Tookitaki is providing machine learning-powered enterprise solutions to address regulatory compliance problems in the financial services sector. Incorporated in November 2014 in Singapore, the company is led by a core team with cumulative 30- yearsâ experience in finance, AI and big data analytics. Backed by institutional investors such as Jungle Ventures and Spring Seeds (a subsidiary of the Singapore Government), the companyâs accolades include:  ï· We are among the selected 21 companies which got accreditation from the government of Singapore for their stringent technology, finance and operations due diligence (www.imda.gov.sg/industry-development/programmes-and- grants/startups/accreditation-at-sgd)  ï· We won the first place in the MAS FinTech Awards (Singapore SME) in the regulatory compliance space from the Monetary Authority of Singapore for our approach to make the workflows in AML and Reconciliation scalable and highly auditable (beyond ML based black box approach) (www.mas.gov.sg/News-and- Publications/Media-Releases/2016/Ten-FinTech-companies-recognised-for- innovative-solutions-at-inaugural-FinTech-Awards.aspx)  ï· We are voted as one of the top 21 AI start-ups focusing on the financial services space by medici (www.letstalkpayments.com/medici-top-21-ai-companies/)  ï· We graduated from Nomura's corporate innovation program in November 2017 where we successfully delivered our product â Reconciliation Management Suite â in a pilot environment (https://inc42.com/buzz/nomura-voyager-fintech- accelerator-voyager-demo-day/)  In regulatory compliance, we focus on anti-money laundering and reconciliation and our products â Alerts Management Suite (AMS) and Reconciliation Management Suite (RMS) â cater to these areas, respectively. The mission or goal is to achieve 40% operational efficiency with significant savings in infrastructure and operational costs. Tookitaki's unique selling proposition (USP) is in our approach where we combine our proprietary modelling technique with our complete auditable framework to make the process dynamic and highly explainable (moving out of the black box approach). Moreover, our flexible on-premise and cloud-packaging capabilities, along with the option of easy integration to exiting core-banking applications (REST API end points), make the solution deployment faster with lesser barrier to entry. Today, regulatory compliance processes have become more complex and fluidic, increasing the chances for rule-based models to fail. Banks need to move beyond static rule-based systems and adopt a new approach to prevent financial and reputation loss. Tookitaki bridges the gap with its innovative software products â AMS, RMS and PMS.
job_requirements: RequirementsData Science @ Tookitaki  The data science team is responsible for solving business problems with complex data. Data complexity could be characterized in terms of volume, dimensionality and multiple touchpoints/sources. We understand the data, ask fundamental-first-principle questions, apply our analytical and machine learning skills to solve the problem in the best way possible. We also encourage to participate in competitions like Kaggle.  Our ideal candidate: We are looking for a senior data scientist who has a deep interest in theoretical and applied machine learning and loves working in a fast-paced environment. He/she should have 5-8 years; work experience in predictive analytics/forecasting space and have solved real-world problems. Candidates with experience in transactional anomaly prediction, operational risk modelling would be given preference. The role would be a client facing one, hence good communication skills are a must. The candidate should have the ability to communicate complex models and analysis in a clear and precise manner. The candidate would be responsible for:  ï· Comprehending business problems properly - what to predict, how to build DV, what value addition he/she is bringing to the client, etc. ï· Understanding and analyzing large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets and build features relevant for business ï· Understanding the math behind algorithms and choosing one over another ï· Understanding approaches like stacking, ensemble and applying them correctly to increase accuracy Desired technical requirements ï· Proficiency with Python and the ability to write production-ready codes. Experience in Scala would be a plus ï· Big data experience, e.g. familiarity with Spark, Hadoop, is highly preferred ï· Familiarity with SQL or other databases. Desired Non-technical Requirements: ï· Very strong communication skills both written and verbal ï· Strong desire to work with start-ups ï· Must be a team player

job_descriptions: Who We Are:  We NS Solutions Asia Pacific (NSAP), together with NS Solutions Japan, provides IT consulting and professional services primarily to financial industry. Distinguishing ourselves from a conventional IT company, we have long standing of relationship with major banking customers with strong track record of in-depth industry knowledge and rich experience of implementing large-scale enterprise systems. NSAP strengthens financial IT services through Project Planning and Promotion, consulting and implementation in Financial Regulation and IFRS arena, and financial data analysis as pivotal pillars of our business growth. As expanding the professional services to financial customers beyond Singapore, we are looking for talented, energetic and versatile staff to accelerate our business. Check our corporate web site for more information: https://global.nssol.nipponsteel.com/sg/ NS Solutions, the parent company, is one of the largest information technology company in Japan, with more than 6,000 professional staffs serving IT consulting and system development for a wide range of customers: manufacturing, finance, retail, telecom, and government sector.  Key Responsibilities:  Interact with business, technology and senior management stakeholders to define business issues, identify necessary data from internal/external sources to be analysed. Conceptualise business problems and solving them through data analysis. Identify and collect structured and unstructured data from multiple data sources to analyse and generate meaningful insights. Analyze large amounts of data to discover trends and patterns using market leading machine learning software. Fine-tune solution by working with business stakeholders including documentation of the data features, definitions and associated metadata. Perform data mapping, cleansing, data quality checks and verification of data integrity to ensure the data set is properly and accurately sorted out to address business issues. Responsible for running Proof of Concept (PoC) project to analyse data by using Machine Learning Software and techniques to develop models that brings values to business. Clearly communicate complex analysis findings through presentation and documentations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
job_requirements: RequirementsJob Requirements:  Minimum 3+ years of experience in data management applications such as business intelligence, management information systems as Data Scientist or Data Analyst. Experience of working with large data set using Machine Learning Algorithms, Traditional or Deep Learning, Data Mining, Advance Analytics and Data Visualisation. Knowledge of advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, predictive modelling, correlations, pattern analysis etc. Deep knowledge of data science best practices to explain proposed data model strength and weaknesses. Having industry expertise background from one of the followings is preferable: Financial (bank, insurance, leasing), Manufacturing, Telecommunications and Retail. Traveling within ASEAN region may be required.  Skills and Competencies:  Bachelor/Master degree with major and/or specialisation in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Information Management is preferred. Visualisation: QlikView, Tableau, Cognos, SAP Business Objects. (regarded as an advantage) Programming Language: R, Python, SAS, and SPSS. (regarded as an advantage) Experience of SQL languages for data orchestration, manipulation and optimization is preferable. Strong attention to detail with clear verbal and written communication skills.

job_descriptions: Observational and Pragmatic Research Institute (OPRI) is a unique academic research institution, working with both the pharmaceutical and academic industry, with the overarching goal to improve the lives of patients through conducting vital global real-world research. OPRI is part of a global network of international companies, with partner companies located in the United Kingdom and Australia. OPRI has been leading the paradigm shift in real-world evidence for the past 12 years, by delivering pragmatic clinical trials, disease registries andÂ database research. We are currently seeking a hard-working and motivated Data Analyst to join our international team. You would be involved in supporting the team developing the first global severe asthma registry ever developed, joining a young and enthusiastic team in supporting a globally-renowned project. Key responsibilities of the role will be to:  Provide support on database querying, population and reporting, using structured query language (SQL). Assist in generate data releases following study protocol requirements and service reports (Tableau). Advise internal team members and external clients on study database(s) content. Engage in building and maintaining data dictionaries and system technical documentation. Undertake quality checks to assure high standards of data and code. Contribute to data analyses as required for research projects. Maintain compliance with information governance and company policies.

Experience in at least one data or statistical package (SAS, R, or Stata) Some experience in data dictionaries and advanced documentation systems.  Key skills:Â data manipulation (SAS, R, or Stata), relational databases (esp. my SQL and SQL Server), clinical or medical research, proactive approach. Desirable: statistical background (models, correlations, hypothesis), general purpose programming languages (e.g. Python), database administration tools (migration, DB administration), experience of working with clinical databases

job_descriptions: COMPANY DESCRIPTION  NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives.  RESPONSIBILITIES  The Analytics Centre transforms big data into actionable insights which enable the SEs to make decision that directly impact the outcomes of their business. Â  By identifying patterns and building models that help to interpret and predict the behaviors of different customer segments, we will uncover opportunities for partners to grow their business through more effective marketing, better product development and stronger customer engagement.Â  We are on the lookout for talented individuals to join us as Business Analysts.Â This role will work very closely with NTUC First Campus Corporate Development team, which is responsible for development and delivery of data analytics solutions to the organization. As a thought and practice leader in the early childhood care and education field, NTUC First Campus (NFC) has been partnering working families to fulfil the promise of young children since 1977. We believe that every child, from every background, deserves opportunity to enjoy a high quality early childhood education for a good start in life. NFC is one of the largest operator of preschool services in Singapore with more than 160 centres and 4,500 staff. Its portfolio of brands includes My First Skool, The Little Skool-House International and The Catepillarâs Cove. NFC also support the development of early childhood educators through its training institute (SEED) Other services include school-based student care services through its afterschool brand and parenting programs through its Parentâs College unit. NFC seeks to leverage on its analytics capabilities to deliver better outcomes for parents, children and staff as to further its social mission. Responsibilities:Â    Work closely with business units and corporate functions to understand priorities and develop analytical models to generate actionable insights that help inform those business decisions Works with team leaders and members to solve client analytics problems and documents results and methodologies Retrieve and clean data to make it usable from a variety of sources (and formats) Performs experimental design approaches to validate finding or test hypotheses. Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples Present the results using visualization tools to stake holders Make and present clear, data-driven, and actionable, recommendations to the business on new initiatives and areas for potential improvement Work closely with the Centralized Analytics Center to inculcate best practices and standardize analytic approach

job_descriptions: COMPANY DESCRIPTION NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives. RESPONSIBILITIES The rapid adoption of technology and mobile devices have contributed to vast new flows of information which are larger in volume, faster in velocity, diverse in variety, and requires veracity of the information for use. This new type of information composed of structured and unstructured data, broadly known as big data (and combined with tools and platforms), if utilised well, could radically improve business performance. Data Governance Officer - He/she will manage all data governance activities and will have responsibility for improving the quality and managing the protection of sensitive data and information assets, respond to regulatory protection requirements. The position will focus on establishing an enterprise data governance framework for data policies, standards and practices. Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards, data protection standards and adoption requirements across the enterprise. Define indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements. Responsibilities:  Design, build and implement the organisation data governance framework. Create and maintain data governance and or data management reporting. Prepare, maintain and present data quality reports. Formulate techniques for quality data collection to ensure adequacy, accuracy and legitimacy of data. Ensure processes and controls are in place. Roll out the relevant data governance framework and policies to various departments, which include obtaining buy-ins from relevant stakeholders to embed operational processes to support the policy objectives. Perform regular review of the data governance framework and policies to ensure they areupdated to meet changing organisational needs. Contribute in terms of best practices and thought leadership in Data Governance & Strategy, and in executing enterprise-wide data governance tasks. Create and maintain common data dictionaries and the tools/methods that support data standards for the organization. Assist with data monitoring and provide organizational management with guidance on streamlining data management.

Well organised and disciplined in maintaining documentation. Familiar in working with SQL, databases, data structures and data modelling concept. Strong inter-personal and people leadership skills to interact with diverse stakeholders.  Preferred technical skills:  Data architecture and data modeling Data Warehouse design ETL/ELT implementation and data integration

job_descriptions: Position Overview Are you passionate about building solutions that support critical Business decisions? Do you feel excited of growing engineering teams and culture? Do you thrive in an environment where you are encouraged to make effective decisions which can have a direct impact on our results? If this sounds like you, read on! Autodesk has completed the transformation of Subscription Business Model and is making investments to become a Customer Company. This means lots of change in business processes and modernize our Sales, Marketing and Support systems. As part of this effort, we are seeking a talented Engineering Manager with rich experiences on various enterprise business applications development, enterprise master data management, data integrations and data analytics, as well as sales, operations and finance related business processes management and optimizations. In this role, you will be responsible of leading one or multiple engineering teams to build and deliver solutions that will improve Autodeskâs business operation efficiencies, ensure data qualities across the company. You will be contributing to our critical initiative of digitizing our sales, marketing and finance systems. You will get an opportunity to contribute to the success of Autodeskâs evolving to a Customer Company. Responsibilities  Lead the Agile teams, and effectively provide guidance in agile ceremonies, including standups, planning, validations, reviews etc, through the entire delivery process. Drive discussions of Business use cases, and work with Business users, development teams, architects to determine most viable solutions. Lead delivery teams to analyze, develop and maintain software applications or solutions in various technologies with dedication to customer satisfactions. Promote and evolve engineering teamsâ culture of delivering high quality products and platforms. Â  Stakeholder management and expectation management. Build and embrace your teamâs vision in contributing to Autodesk success.
job_requirements: RequirementsMinimum Qualifications  10+ years of professional experiences working in projects implementing sales/marketing/finance related solutions or applications. 2+ years of people and project management, leading agile delivery teams. Rich experience with Scrum and agile development practices. Expert hands on knowledge on various system and data integrations solutions, including API (RESTful, SOAP), ETL tools, data models and data transformations. Good knowledge around master data management and enterprise data profiles. Having good experiences managing Business stakeholders and senior leadershipsâ expectations. Passionate about learning new technologies and applying into your job. Excel at collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to deliver great user experience. Flexibilities and accountabilities. Â  Strong written and oral communication skills.  Preferred Qualifications  10+ years of experiences in enterprise applications developments, such as ERP systems, CRM applications, data Integration tools/processes, BI reporting or financial analytical applications. Solid understanding of relational database concepts, SQL query statements, SQL Server programmability. Experiences in analyzing and designing master data management solution. Experience in developing functionally applicable unit tests and adopting Continuous Integration processes  Success Factors  Lead engineering team delivery high quality solutions. Grow strong engineering practices and culture. Take accountability to achieve team goals and support others to do the same. Articulate and communicate clearly to all stakeholder, including developers, architects, other managers and business owners. Work collaboratively to achieve team successes. Provide guidenance to your team members on technology solutions, processes and delivery approaches. Offer constructive feedback that will help us achieve business results Action oriented with strong analytical problem solving and effective decision-making skills  About Autodesk Innovative. Rewarding. Respectful.Â  These are words we hear every day from employees about life at Autodesk. To empower our customer with technology that impacts the world, we start by empowering our employees to make a difference.Â  We encourage employees to demonstrate their expertise, mentor the team, make effective decisions and be an order Shaper. Autodesk Employees are free to share opinions and know that they will be respectfully listened to. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. Itâs disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

job_descriptions: Answering the NOC Hotline & Following theÂ ISO work procedure. Able to operateÂ ticketing & services system and equipment monitoring. (Email, IDCMS, CCTV, etc.) Assist visitors in terms of access registration and escorting which includes but not limited to the following such as third-party vendors to BCP room check in/out. Responsible for the Transmission network, including International Private Leased Circuit and International Ethernet Private Line network service monitoring, troubleshooting and maintenance. Oversee the running of data cables during the installation of new equipment. Ensure work operations comply with all local, state, and federal regulations on information/data management Monitor customer network servers and storage systems to ensure uptime and efficient resolution of issues. Working knowledge and hands on experience with Firewalls includingÂ  setting up and support IPSEC and SSL VPNs. Working knowledge of common switching and routing protocolÂ including but not limited to TCP/IP, VTP, Spanning Tree, EIGRP; OSPF.

job_descriptions: Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team rewarded with innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, youâll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. Youâll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where youâand the products you deliverâwill thrive. As an experienced Infrastructure Development professional, your mission is to help lead our team of innovators and technologists toward creating next-level solutions that improve the way our business is run. Your hands-on knowledge in system design, application development, testing and operational stability will help your team deliver high quality products. Youâll be instrumental in solving more difficult technical issues, developing integration elements, building data models, APIs, and open 3rd-party SDKs. Youâll see your ideas come to life as part of a small, success-driven team. Your quest to embracing leading-edge technologies and methodologies inspires your team to follow suit. And best of all, youâll be able to harness massive amounts of brainpower through our global network of technologists from around the world to tackle big challenges. Key Responsibilities will include design and implementation of enterprise grade solutions for technical data management, including data sourcing, ingestion, persistence, and presentation â while ensuring quality of deliverables and adhering to standards in areas of code quality, secure coding, test coverage, monitoring, logging, exception management, operability and maintainability. You will be expected to excel and lead in a team environment, demonstrate strong interpersonal skills, collaborate and build relationships with other development teams, operations partners and business clients.
job_requirements: RequirementsÂ  This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: â¢BS/BA degree or equivalent experience â¢Provide technical expertise throughout the software lifecycle including design, implementation and delivery. â¢Understanding cloud , virtualization, APIs, and modern software languages â¢Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages: Java, Python, C, C++, GoExperience with developing frameworks that helps increasing developer and release velocity, improving code health and technical standards â¢Advanced experience working with two or more from the following: web application development,Â  database, unix/linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, information retrieval, networking, large scale software development, security software development â¢Understanding or have experience with agile and lean philosophies â¢Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills with clear communication â¢Ability to collaborate with different roles to achieve common goals â¢Minimum 10 years of hands-on full development lifecycle experience (preferably on Java based platforms) with extensive experience in designing and developing large scale, mission critical enterprise grade software. Experience with debugging, performance profiling and optimization. â¢Minimum 4 years experience with big data/NoSQL (Hive/Hbase/Solr/Spark/Cassandra/elasticsearch) â including understanding of cluster-topology and sharding/partitioning. â¢Possess at least 3 years of message driven development (Kafka or Tibco EMS, MQ) experience for high volume based platforms and scalable distributed systems â¢Experience in highly scalable REST/web service, caching servers, SOAP, HTTPS. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.Â   At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and weâre building a technology organization that thrives on diversity.Â  We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation.Â  If youâre looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.Â  We strongly encourage all applicants to apply via our careers website where you are able join our Talent Network to receive customized vacancy notifications and ensure that your details are accessible by our global recruiting team - www.jpmorganchase.com/careers. job_descriptions: Salesforce Solution Architect / Presales  Participate actively in presales activities including presentations, demonstrations, understanding customer requirements, sizing up the efforts and estimations. Support relationships based selling and assume a technical lead role transitioning sales from qualifying to closing by working closely with sales team and other technical consultants. Work closely with sales teams internally to maximize the business development capability and leverage organisation capabilities. Facilitate and execute requirements gathering and technical analysis and design phases, assist in driving Business Development initiatives with major stakeholders. Work with the delivery team closely and help develop and refine the best practices for Salesforce projects.  Â  Responsibilities:  Participate in all aspects of sales and customer engagement activities such as solution presentation, conducting workshops, demonstration and Proof of Concepts (POC) Involve in gathering, understanding and scoping the requirements, sizing the efforts and providing the estimations Provide documentations for the proposed solution with Scope of Work, Assumptions and Technical write-ups Lead the team in delivering the Salesforce solution by performing the complete SDLC, requirement gathering, analysis, design, development, installation, test and implementation Provide technical support to all team members during project execution Collaborating with end users to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery Improving and streamlining processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve data accuracy, viability and value Mentoring the Salesforce team but also other service lines for cross selling optimization
job_requirements: Requirements The Salesforce Solution Architect should have minimum 6 years of consulting and end-to-end implementation experience in delivering Salesforce solutions for enterprise, ideally have a Degree in Computer Science or equivalent Strong experience in multiple domains/industries with Salesforce platform and ecosystems will be essential Strong understanding of customer segmentation, master data management, customer dedup and customer 360 data principles Strong experience in using modern software architecture such as MVC, SOA, SOAP, REST and cloud/cloud hybrid models Good knowledge and strong hands-on experience in data integration tools and business systems (ERP, POS, WMS, ETL, BI/DW, Big Data, CRM, marketing automation, ecommerce, analytics, etc.) Familiarity with platform authentication patterns (SAML, SSO, OAuth) Strong experience with environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies

job_descriptions: An exciting opportunity for an offshore work as Lead Document Controller with a leading oil and gas company awaits the successful candidate. Â  JOB DIMENSIONS Â The service holder is responsible for all the activities related to Documentation control and Documentation Management through COMPANYâS EDMS for the LNG Project, and other tools as necessary. The primary objective is to ensure that all the documents (correspondence & technical) produced by Project team or by Contractors and Vendors during the Execution phase are developed and managed in accordance with the Project Document Control procedures. Â  The service holder is responsible for implementing the strategy for the Documentation and Documentation Management System and the adequate organisation and means (human and tools) for the best management of documentation during the Project phase (pre-FID and Execution) in the various Project Documentation Control Centres, up to the timely preparation and hand-over of the necessary and adequate documentation to Operation teams and to archives. Â  The service holder is also responsible for implementing / maintaining the Documentation plan and procedures that will define the rules for numbering and process of documents (external / internal). The service holder will be supported by a team composed of several Document Controllers who will be dedicated to Work Packages Document Control activities. Â  The service holder will have to liaise actively with Contractors for the implementation of the Documentation and Documentation Management strategy, with concerned Corporate Departments for the implementation of Projectâs EDMS and as a general manner with all the Project members, all being involved in document production and management. Â  ACTIVITIES Â   To adopt & demonstrate an exemplary behavior with regard to HSSE requirements. To have knowledge of Company Specifications (GSâs/GRâs), Companyâs and Corporate procedures, etc. related to Documentation and Data Management for application to the Project To define, develop, implement and maintain a Documentation and Documentation Management plan detailing the strategy adopted, the organisation set-up as well as the means and tools defined accordingly. To implement and maintain procedures, specifications, means and tools required to ensure an efficient management of all flows of documents either on an electronic form of on paper form during all the phases of the Project and in all project work locations To organise, supervise, control and support the Documentation section (several Document Controllers) in the performance of their duties all along the course of the Project. To participate in the implementation of the Documentation and Documentation Management system at Contractorsâ, setting-up and explaining rules and procedures, jointly with the assigned Document Controller and with the help of concerned Corporate Departments To define, set-up and maintain KPI for documentation and participate as necessary to Project reporting wrt to Documentation activities and observe and impose strict confidentiality in the performance of the documentation  Â  Â  CONTEXT/ ENVIRONMENT LNG project is a combine onshore and offshore project development comprising:  Well pads and the upstream gathering network including flowlines and trunklines; Upstream Central Processing Facility (CPF); Main onshore and offshore export system consisting of a single-phase gas pipeline and a condensate pipeline; Integration in existing liquefaction plant located 325 km from the CPF in the vicinity.  Â  DURATION/LOCATION - Starting date: ASAP - no later than mid-May 2019 - Duration : 12 months - Renewable: yes - Location: Paris 2/3 months then Singapore - Status: residential
job_requirements: Requirements- Qualification: Technician, or equivalent with sound knowledge in Documentation management through EDMS - Languages: English mandatory - Professional Experience: 10/20 years - Experience within project: 10 years at same or equivalent position with managerial responsibilities

job_descriptions: Department overview: IHS Markit EDM is focused on providing a data management platform targeted at the growing needs of financial services companies. Since its launch in 2003, IHS Markit EDM has become one of the most successful and fastest growing providers of data management solutions to the financial services industry. Â  Position summary This role will have the responsibility for developing the sales activities for IHS Markit EDM suite of solutions and services across South East Asia financial institutions. The position reports into the regional Head of Sales, and provides responsibility for new sales over a defined territory, including all aspects of the role including pipeline building, qualification of leads, progression of opportunities until closing as well as identifying and managing a network of local partners. Â  Job Description The candidate will work as the main driver of revenue acquisition across assigned accounts and product lines and will ensure that the business goals are achieved. The candidate will work within the Financial Markets and Energy sales teams to generate leads, and work closely with other EDM teams to close the qualified opportunities. Specifically, duties & responsibilities include:  Generation of new lead pipeline for new business and existing clients in South East Asia Propose and defend business strategies for the South East Asian markets to internal management Proactively propose and conduct sales campaigns to identify new potential business Maintain pipeline and generate management reports (cold calls list, user list etc.) from Salesforce Identify and qualify the clientâs needs and determine how to best position the EDM suite of solutions and services Be self-sufficient on all steps of a software selling process to deliver against the sales target, with the help of the various internal EDM teams Take responsibility for acquiring and keeping Markit EDM product knowledge to a high standard by actively working with the relevant internal EDM teams Identification and building of relationships with potential partners on the various markets to boost sales Attendance to key market conferences  Â

job_descriptions: We are looking for a Test Practice Lead to develop the overall test strategy as well as to plan test architecture and roadmap, discovery and development of test execution. The candidate will lead the test community as well as to work closely with the application delivery teams to drive the transition of continuous testing as part of SIA overall continuous development strategy.  The Test Lead will be part of the overall organization Delivery centre in helping SIA delivery teams adopt better engineering practices. Â  Key responsibilities include:   Design and develop automation framework, which is required to cover both functional and non-functional testing, and scripting for both Web and Mobile products that can be adopted across the organisation. Provide technical leadership and expertise in the field of Testing and Quality Assurance. Oversee the adoption of these automation framework in different agile squads within SIA. Proactively identify problems, plan solutions, recommend software and systems, and coordinate developments in an orderly manner to meet business requirements. Gather and present testing metrics and testing activities for key product developments to key stakeholders. Provide technical development, mentoring, and guide the work of others in test automation. Be an escalation point for matters relating to testing and quality assurance. Coordinate with development and testing teams to ensure the virtual services and VSEs provide full test coverage starting from unit testing phase through to QA/System and various testing phases. Provide full governance of the virtual services and the VSEs, and supports all service consumers across all teams. Provide guidance from discover, generate, profile, transform, enrich, cleanse, extract, subset, mask, load, validate, refresh, archive and purge data in proposed test data management tools. Coordinate with development and testing teams to ensure the virtual services and VSEs provide full test coverage starting from unit testing phase through to QA/System and various testing phases. Any other ad-hoc related duties. This is a sole contributor role.

Demonstrated knowledge of Agile Principles and practices (Scrum, Kanban). Ability to analyse and resolve problems of high complexity, requiring expert knowledge of hardware components, systems, software, and networking technologies. Additional job skills include, but are not limited to: excellent project management skills; excellent written, oral and interpersonal communications skills; and excellent analytical/creative problem-solving skills. Working experience with the following test tooling is preferred: CA LISA Virtualization, Cucumber, Selenium, Perfecto.

job_descriptions: A Research Associate position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) http://www.eee.ntu.edu.sg is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and research. With more than 150 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,000 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world and ranks 6th in the field of Electrical & Electronic Engineering in the 2017 QS World University Rankings by Subjects. Job Description Recent studies have found that deep models can be easily fooled by adversarial examples, which poses a big challenge for those safety-critical applications like autonomous vehicles. The position is open for those who are interested in deep learning and computer vision. The successful candidate should be familiar with object detection or semantic segmentation algorithm which will be used as our attack and defensive objective. Then the candidate will be responsible for further research in the adversarial machine learning field to realize the attack and perturbation resistant techniques. The successful candidate is expected to contribute in the research comprises the following topics: (1) Enhance the attacks on open-source object detection model; (2) Evaluate and enhance defenses against adversarial examples; (3) Develop robustness evaluation and fooling recovery solutions on deep learning systems. Apart from working on technical aspects of research projects, the Research Associate will also take charge of general matters for the project, including data management and project documentation, writing project updates, and doing product demonstrations and presentations.
job_requirements: Requirements Master in Engineering, preferably in control engineering, electrical engineering, computer science and technology, mechanical engineering, or information security; Good experience in machine learning and deep learning basics; Good knowledge in optimization (or Game theory), reinforcement learning is a plus.  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_titles: Junior Computer Vision Engineer for Deep learning applied to Real World Robotic System
job_descriptions: Introduction TUMCREATE is a leading Research Institute set up by the Technical University of Munich, Germany in collaboration with the Singapore Government. TUMCREATE has received funding and support for the SPEEDCARGO project from the Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) & the national Research Foundation (NRF) to develop automation solutions that will transform the Air Freight Logistics sector. The SPEEDCARGO solution will be the world's first AI-powered robotic solution for automatic build-up and break down of aviation cargo pallets and will help Singapore lead the transformation of the Logistics industry globally. The project is seeking technical experts with a passion for creating world class products, and a willingness to work in a fast paced, quality obsessed, multi-cultural global environment. On successful completion, the project will be spun off as a start-up with members of the project team having the option to join the start-up with benefits that include attractive ESOPs. Apply now if you are interested in working on cutting edge technologies, changing the world with your work and joining a dynamic start-up team. More details on the project: https://www.speedcargo.sg/ Â  Background The design of real-world robotic systems is a multi-disciplinary effort. It involves the development of advanced perception systems, artificial intelligence based decision making, mechanical elements like sensors and actuators, electronic components for connecting and controlling the mechanical elements and software for higher-level planning and process control. This job profile focuses on development of specific computer vision modules for the perception system within SPEEDCARGO. It will involve the following specific task which the successful candidate will have to execute towards a real world working application.  Photo realistic texture generation and mapping for synthesizing geometry and appearance of airfreight shipments. This data will be used for training a deep neural network Implementing a C++ pipeline for a deep edge neural network trained on the data set specific in point 1 Integrating, testing a deploying the module within CargoEye Algorithm for generating synthetic data of closely packed boxes on a airfreight ULD pallet adhering to airline regulations. Using this dataset to do deep edge learning using the framework specified in point 2 Design, modelling and implementation of a 3D calibration framework for 3D camera sets using a non-planer and precision engineered cubic pattern  What we offer you  An international and multidisciplinary working environment Opportunity to work on deep-tech robotic system Challenging tasks with real-life relevance  Â
job_requirements: RequirementsMandatory Requirements  Since the project will focus on real world deployment of industrial robotics system we require the candidate to have hands on experience working on computer vision for real world systems (preferable in Industry). PhD/Master/Bachelor Degree from a reputed university Strong fundamentals in computer science and mathematics related to Computer Vision. job_descriptions: A Research Fellow position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research. To support teaching and cutting-edge research, EEE is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories, which are well-equipped with modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment. With about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,300 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world. Job Description To treat neurological patients, an in-depth analysis and understanding of patient-specific EEG is required and critical. However, visual inspection of EEG recordings is prohibitively time-consuming, and most hospitals do not have the personnel for this task. Automated algorithms to inspect EEG will allow us to analyse much larger volumes of EEG signals, in turn allowing us to build up a detailed database of waveforms associated with epilepsy and other neurological disorders. It has potential application in real-time seizure detection, non-expert EEG evaluation, and improved understanding of neurological disorders. We will develop deep learning methods for analysing EEG signals, which is an entirely new approach with much potential. Deep learning methods have consistently outperformed standard methods for speech and image analysis, and are expected to outshine existing methodologies also for biomedical signals and EEG in particular. In this project, we have the following aims: Aim1: To apply existing deep learning algorithms (CNN and LSTM recurrent networks) for the specific application of recognizing patterns in time series, and identify strengths and weaknesses of the existing algorithms. Aim2: To develop novel deep learning algorithms based on Bayesian variational inference and other approaches, for the specific application of recognizing patterns in time series. Aim3:Â  To apply these deep learning algorithms for reliable EEG-based BCI classification and automatic detection of epileptic seizures from pediatric EEG (Physionet dataset). The Research Fellow will assist in conducting this research, writing journal publications, and preparing grant applications.
job_requirements: Requirements PhD degree in electrical engineering, computer science, or statistics Minimum 2 years of relevant experience Required skills include signal processing, machine learning, EEG analysis, programming in Matlab, Python, C++, or C  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Youâll work closely with Product and Software Engineers to ship self-sustaining reliable products You strive to automate everything a system does and want the easiest deployments for all concerned. Youâll frequently ask yourself âhow can I make DevOps practices betterâ, and contribute towards these improvements within Zendesk as well as within the SF Bay Area DevOps community. Â  What you get to do every day:  Tackle complex problems and provide simple elegant solutions Advise product teams during the design of cloud architecture and technology choices Act as an escalation point for product performance concerns Collaborate with your Operations teammates in Madison, Melbourne, and San Francisco Use a wide variety of technologies, wear lots of hats (actual hats optional) Work in an agile development environment and believe that pragmatism always triumphs over dogmatism Perform occasional pager duty on-call duties Help us run our platform and manage fast growth Drive architecture design discussions and find ways for Zendesk to improve the environment in which our services run Own and deliver projects aimed at improving infrastructure or delivering direct services to customers Lead Zendesk Engineering in one or more domain expert areas  What you bring to the role:  Python, AWS, and Chef are the cornerstones of our operation. Aside from that, we use diverse technologies and youâll wear many hats. We donât expect anyone to be familiar with all of them (if you are please talk to us now) Configuration Management expertise (Chef, Puppet, Salt or Ansible) Python frameworks, Go and Ruby experience is ideal Service discovery technologies, like Consul or Zookeeper AWS orchestration tools, like Cloudformation or Terraform Kubernetes, AWS EKS, or other PaaS technologies MySQL, Redis, Memcached, MongoDB, Hadoop, RIAK, Cassandra, Kafka Monitoring and logging with Nagios, Datadog and ELK stack Youâll also have great communication skills (written and verbal) that will enable successful collaboration with all our teams.

job_descriptions: Job Description The Analytics System team is seeking an exceptional Analytics Engineer (AE) to join team. In this individual contributor role, this person will play a key role in providing reporting and analytical solutions to the various stakeholders. The candidate should possess Finance Domain knowledge and experience to able to support key users of the Finance and Treasury team. Â  Key responsibilities include:  Create and maintain optimal data pipeline from Source systems/data to Analytics platform using programming (such as Python and SQL) Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Build data infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources Build data model suitable for analytics tools (such as Tableau) that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics. Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. Ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them to the stakeholders and senior management as required Support and maintain Analytics system and review regularly priorities with the stakeholders  Â  Basic Qualifications  Advanced knowledge in using Open Source programming such as Python and familiar with libraries such as pandas for ETL transformation Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases. Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures and data sets. Strong analytic skills related to working with structured and unstructured datasets. Successful experience of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets. Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. Good project management and organizational skills. BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field 3+ years of relevant work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence, or related field Have application knowledge of common statistical methods  Â

As part of this work, in partnership with BCG Digital Ventures (part of the Boston Consulting Group), we have built a MVP for a predictive shipping analytics platform using the latest Machine Learning and AI technologies. job_descriptions: COMPANY DESCRIPTION  NTUC Enterprise Co-operative Limited is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC group of Social Enterprises. We aim to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives. The NTUC Enterprise Centre of Excellence for Data, Digitalisation and Technology leads the transformation of the NTUC Social Enterprises by leveraging digital technologies to become more nimble, adaptable and innovative in todayâs digital age. The NTUC Enterprise Centre of Excellence for Data, Digitalisation and Technology has been registered as NTUC Enterprise Nexus, a wholly owned subsidiary of NTUC Enterprise.  RESPONSIBILITIES   Work as part of the Analytics team to develop analytical solutions, most frequently in the form of data visualizations and interactive dashboards Can work hands on with SQL, Python to develop Data Model, queries, Scripts or debug existing code Experience with Git Repo creation, maintenance of scripts/code Create, schedule, and monitor server-based BI activities such as data extracts and refreshes in tableau or Airflow/any other equivalent tool Define, populate, and maintain user groups and user access within analytical tools Build optimal Dashboards on Big Data, Audit reporting performance and optimize when necessary Assist in performing and testing to deploy dashboards in production Assist in user adoption and enablement activities such as delivering training sessions or writing instructional content for BI tools Understand business goals and drivers and translate those into appropriate analytics solutions

job_descriptions: Successful candidates will be part of the Incident Response Team that manages and investigates cyber security incidents. As a Cyber Threat Hunter (Data), you play an important role in finding unsecured systems containing sensitive data, and to reduce the dwell time of incidents. What to Expect:  Research, analyse and triage various intelligence sources and translate them into actionable cyber intelligence for security operations team Leverage internal and external resources to sieve out threats, vulnerabilities and information on various attackers and attack infrastructure Perform advanced threat research to proactively identify potential threat vectors and work with multi-disciplines to improve prevention and detection methods Review threat information and maintain threat intelligence platform (TIP) or threat repository Provide threat analysis and landscape report to stakeholders on a timely basis  How to Succeed:  Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Cybersecurity or related fields. Those without a degree but have relevant experience or expertise may also apply. Possess at least 2 years working experience as CTI Analyst or at least 3 years of experience in Incident Response / Handling Experience in cyber threat intelligence gathering and able to develop patterns related to cyber threats Experience with a common scripting or programming language, including Perl, Python, Bash or Powershell Fresh Graduates with strong passion and demonstrated capability in Cyber Threat Intelligence will be considered  Other Requirements:  Security certifications like CISSP, GCIH, GCFE would be favoured Highly developed research and analytical skills Critical thinking and contextual analysis abilities Possess good communication and interpersonal skills Applicant must be a Singapore Citizen

job_descriptions: The Software Practice is a technology company based in Singapore that builds software for clients and its own business. Our core strength is in building large and complex web and mobile applications. Weâre a full service development firm whoâve launched several products working with clients from an idea to a prototype to production with real world users. In the past, weâve built applications that have been used by hundreds of thousands of users. Our expertise lies in being able to architect stable, highly scalable and performant software for the web and mobile platforms. Our clients range from small start-ups looking to build and launch their product from scratch toÂ  critical internal applications for Government organizations (like DSTA - the Defence Science and Technology Agency and BCA - the Building Construction Authority of Singapore). We've also built public facing web applications for the financial sector for some of SE Asia's major banks - DBS, OCBC and UOB. One of our more recent projects was the launch of mobile applications (iOS and Android) for the Malaysia Airports Holdings Berhad featuring flights, shopping information for passengers and indoor navigation for Kuala Lumpur International Airport.Â Â  We work on a number of technologies and tend to hire smart people who can pick up new tech-stacks and get things done quickly. Just in the last year, we've worked on projects using ReactJS, AngularJS, Python, ReactNative, .NET and Solidity.
job_requirements: RequirementsWe'd like someone to join us as UI/UX Designer to define, create and manage our marketing collateral, pitch material and handle UI/UX on all software projects. We work on a breadth of projects - so you'll have plenty of diverse and complex design problems on a daily basis.Â  Requirements Excellent HTML and CSS skills. Experience with building responsive websites by hand, and familiarity with frameworks like Bootstrap and Foundation (by Zurb) A great portfolio and a love for color, layout, typography and iconography Highly motivated and detail oriented Well versed in Photoshop and Illustrator Please send over a link to your portfolio. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. You'll get to work in a fast-paced environment, with a great team of full-stack engineers who have a lot of experience in building large scale web applications from scratch.

job_descriptions: Circles.Life is Asiaâs first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in 2016 and have been rapidly gaining market share while delivering best in class customer experience. We are leading the market in innovation, customer satisfaction and growth. We have an opening for aÂ Billing Operations EngineerÂ who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure in a hyper-growth environment in Singapore.Â  Do you want to get first-hand insights on how a hyper-growth company operates?Â  Are you interested in being part of a fun, energetic team that thrives in an entrepreneurial tech environment?Â  If the answer isÂ YES, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life!Â  Job DescriptionÂ  As ourÂ Billing Operations Engineer, you will be part of our Network Engineering Â Team here in Singapore you will be given a unique opportunity to work on high impact projects across different teams. job_descriptions: About the Company Circles.Life is Worldâs first and most successful digital telco. We have a mission: to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer through our customer centric mobile platform and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar global telco industry. We launched our services in Singapore in 2016 and have since gained market share quickly while delivering best-in-class customer experience. Currently Circles beats all other telcos on metrics like NPS, subscriber growth, average data used per subscriber and overall customer satisfaction. Â Â   Our customers use ~3x the data compared to rest of the market. They are forever online and are digital natives. We are putting together a team that can use this treasure trove of data and develop the most complete understanding of customers that telco industry has ever seen. We have an opening for aÂ QA Automation EngineerÂ who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure at a rapidly scaling telco startup in Singapore. Do you want to get first hand insights on how a rapidly scaling tech startup operate?Â Â  Do you enjoy working within an entrepreneurial environment, having personal freedom to act, and be part of a fun, energetic team who are running at full speed to ignite a digital disruption in telecommunications? If the answer isÂ YES, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life! Do you want to continually make code quality go up and raise the bar for everybody! job_descriptions: If you are a software engineering leader who is passionate about building innovative products that scale to ten of millions of pageview a day, Indeed is looking for you. As an engineering manager at Indeed, you will be tasked to provide hands-on leadership for a full-stack development team building and enhancing products and systems in our service-oriented, highly-scalable, multi-datacenter environment. As the organization grows, you will help to ensure we keep the talent bar high, and growing the skills and capabilities of your team. At Indeed, we love data. As a part of a highly data-driven organization, you wonât have to guess at the impact youâre having; youâll leverage our large-scale data analysis infrastructure to define, measure, and test your hypotheses and deliver the best possible experience for the jobseeker. At Indeed, our primary technology stack is Java-based, but we believe strongly in using the right tool for the right job. As such, weâre rapidly adopting emerging best-of-breed technologies and incorporating them into our stack. This includes things like React/Redux, React Native, Python/Django, MongoDB, Go, and Mesos, to name a few. Additionally, sometimes the right tool for the job doesnât exist, so weâve created and open-sourced a number of our core systems. You can explore them on GitHub and YouTube.
job_requirements: Requirements Significant prior success as a Software Engineer working on challenging problems of scaleÂ  Solid knowledge of data structures and algorithms and excellent programming skillsÂ  The ability to guide a team to achieve important goals togetherÂ  The desire to solve tough problems with quality software at scaleÂ  An understanding of the value derived from shipping code rapidly to production and learning/iterating on the results. Strong ability to coach developers, helping them improve their skills and grow their careersÂ  A deep understanding of the web Strong knowledge of databases, both SQL and NoSQLÂ  Experience with service-oriented and event-driven system architecturesÂ  Experience building high-performance distributed systems  Indeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs. View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits Â

job_descriptions: Software engineering takes the central roles for building Traveloka products and systems. You will be responsible for designing, building, improving, or maintaining our web applications, third-party data integration, data API, backend systems, or working with monitoring tools and infrastructure. You may work on our search engine including scoring and relevance, reservation engine, automated pricing engine, business process engine, data applications, devops-related applications, and other new projects. You will work in cross-functional teams and meet great people regularly from top tier technology, consulting, product, or academic background. We work in open environment where there are no boundaries or power distance. Everyone is encouraged to speak their mind, propose ideas, influence others, and continuously grow themselves. Get the exposure to multi-aspect, collaborative, intensive startup experience with our recent expansion into Southeast Asia and exploration of new products. Opportunities within Traveloka:   Front End (Web) - HTML5/CSS3/Javascript   Back End - Java/ .Net/ NodeJS   Full Stack - Javascript and Python / Java   Mobile (iOS) - Swift, Objective C   Mobile (Android) - Java/ Android Technologies   Mobile (React Native) - Web Technologies   DevOps - Go, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services   SDET/ QA - black box, white box testing; risk based testing, regression and exploratory testing   Security - secure coding guidelines, static analysis and penetration testing. Working with tools such as sqlmap, qark, sqlninja, beef, Metasploit, http proxies and debugging tools

Able to communicate complex ideas with stakeholders of different background

Your role at PALO IT  You will be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Practices. You will have the chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. Firmly focusing on international expansion, we have offices in France, Hong Kong, Singapore, Sydney andÂ Mexico, meet us to continue this growth ! job_descriptions: Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek ---- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com. This Software/Computer engineer is part of Factory Automation/Solution Engineering team, particularly focusing on supply chain tool, data analytics and dashboard development and deployment. Factory Automation Engineering team works on several hardware and software automation projects along with production/supply chain efficiency projects. Strong project management skill, interpersonal/communication skill, supply chain experience/knowledge and programming skills in C-Family (C, C++, Java, C#), Python, HTML, Visual Basic; are essential. Projects include:  Software automation development for supply chain and planning efficiency improvements. Supply chain and other Business Metrics data mining automation. Development of software or tool or GUI for supply chain and business request. Create supply chain automation or software tool to enable supply chain data analysis for improvement opportunities. Lead and manage data solutions projects with cross functional team. Analyse complex problems, interpret operational needs, and develop creative & innovative solutions involving data model design/ reporting assembly/ application structure. Collaborate with validation engineer on computerized system validation for ISO9001 and ISO13485 compliance.
job_requirements: RequirementsQualifications:   The job candidate must have a Bachelors or Masters Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering with minimum of 8+ years relevant experience in software development and supply chain. Candidates with other Engineering qualification with proven track records in software/computer engineering skills in supply chain field are encouraged to apply.  Experience in the following areas are mandatory:   Supply chain knowledge, understanding and experience. Programming skill/languages: C-Family (C#, C++, Java), HTML, Visual Basic, Python. Ability to communicate needs, plans and achievements at all levels of a corporate organization. Demonstrated ability to set priorities and meet commitments. Ability to simultaneously participate in multiple issues as they arise in a manufacturing environment. Ability to work in a hands-on environment. Ability to take on new challenges and learn from the experience of co-workers. Experience scheduling and completing tasks on schedule. Project coordination and management skills. Proven advanced verbal and written communication skills including data visualization skills. Strong interpersonal skills -- crisp and passionate communicator. Self-motivated, independent and able to multi task.  Agilent is an equal opportunity employer.

job_descriptions: Canopy (https://canopy.cloud/) is a "make sense of your data" financial technology start-up. We provide aggregation, visualization, analytics, and reporting services to financial institutions, wealth managers, and high net-worth individuals. What you'll do:  Join the Engineering Team as a Ruby on Rails (+Python) developer with the ability to program our APIs Familiarity with the Dockerised environment and being able to take over the 3-year-old codebase Modularize reusable parts and contribute to open source community Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions/rearchitect Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization

job_descriptions: We are looking for a driven and analytical Back-End Developer to join our team!Â You will be working together with the Front-End Developer to build web service applications that will be used by thousands of customers. Your primary focus will be on the development of server-side logic (in Python), definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application. A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well. Responsibilities:  Research, evaluate and analyse technical and design requirements. Plan and implement model data structures for high scalability. Develop software related to portfolio asset and risk management. Create database schemas that represent and support business processes. Process multiple data sources, databases and output in different forms. Identify and suggest various methods to improve function efficiency and code quality. Validate models and algorithmic techniques. Implement automated testing platforms and unit tests. Troubleshoot and fix bugs/flaws to ensure servers are running optimally. Participate in all phases of the development life cycle.
job_requirements: Requirements Degree in Computer Science or relevant fields. 2+ years of web API development experience preferred. Strong written and oral communication skills. Proficient knowledge of back-end programming language (Restful API). In-depth knowledge of different Python frameworks (e.g. Django, Flask). Understanding of at least one database connections (MySQL/PostgresSQL/MongoDB). Familiarity with data analysis tools (Numpy/Scipy/Pandas/Matlab). Familiarity with Linux/Unix/Shell environments. Strong hands-on skills in sourcing, cleaning, manipulating and analysing of large volumes of data. Basic understanding of front-end technologies and platforms, such as JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3. User authentication and authorisation between multiple systems, servers and environments. Understanding of âsession managementâ in a distributed server environment.   Programming Platform/Languages:  Linux/MacOS Python (Flask/DJANGO/Pyramid) HTML/CSS SQL (MySQl/PostGres/MongoDB)  To apply for this job opportunity, please send your updated resume toÂ careers@mafint.com. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you.

job_descriptions: Job Title: Software Engineer (Linux/Python)  Job Location: Singapore Company Overview Â  Accellion, Inc. is an award-winning private company that enables enterprise organizations to collaborate on content with external partners securely via private cloud. The primary technology team is based in Singapore and our customers are distributed worldwide. Â  Enterprises can leave existing content where it lives today, and extend it outside the firewall without having to migrate content or disrupt their business workflows. Accellionâs solutions are used by more than 15 million users and 2,500 of the worldâs leading corporations and government agencies. The kiteworks solution is a private cloud secure content collaboration platform that enables organizations toÂ shareÂ their content with external partners seamlessly, with the highest levels of security and control. WithÂ kiteworks, organizations can extend their existing content systems without costly content migrationsÂ orÂ disruptionsÂ toÂ workflows. Position The Software Engineer position is based in Singapore. We are looking for highly driven, talented and self-motivated Engineers to join a team of world-class engineers. job_descriptions: About Esri Singapore Established in 1980, Esri Singapore is one of the most recognized contributors to the geospatial community. Our team of geospatial and industry professionals in Singapore serves a growing community of 700 organizations comprising of the countryâs government agencies and commercial enterprises. Throughout our growth, Esri Singapore has assembled an impressive track-record, successfully supporting major projects and organizations in national development, national security, infrastructure, smart nation and innovation initiatives. Beyond this, Esri Singapore also maintains strong ties with the local community, providing services to not-for-profit and educational institutions. The geospatial domain is set for tremendous growth and change in the years to come and a position in Esri Singapore is one of the best for leveraging on this trend. Core Values Integrity Â Â |Â  Â Professional Excellence Â Â | Â Â Resourcefulness Â Â |Â Â  Empathy Â âBuilding a stronger future through geographic insightâ Our User SuccessÂ Team consists of trusted advisors, constantly helping our customers to adopt, extend and deepen the application of GIS in their areas of work as well as expanding their knowledge. Our solutions have been implemented across multiple business domains that spans from commercial businesses, to national agencies and public safety and Esriâs ArcGIS platform has become an integral part of our customerâs business. We are on the search for candidates who are motivated to contribute to the success of our customers by providing domain and technical expertise and designing innovative solutions and ideas that bridge the gap between spatial technology and real-world business challenges. If you are passionate to be part of a global community ofÂ technology professionals, who collectively believe geography provides the answers for a more resilient future and is committed to create responsible solutions to real-world problems â then weâve got the career opportunities youâve been looking for. Â  Overall objectives of the role:  Develop and implement software solutions or applications for enterprise customers. Configure and tailor off-the-shelf solutions to suit end userâs needs. Contribute to all stages of a project life cycle including conducting requirements study with end users, solutioning, development of requirements, system and design documentation and application support and maintenance. Work with a variety of development environments such as HTML5, Java, .NET and other object-oriented environments or scripting languages (e.g. Python) Work with spatial datasets and data formats. Work independently as well as collaboratively as an active contributor in a highly skilled team. Contribute to engagements with end-users such as workshops, exhibitions, technical support, and training delivery. Manage delivery engagements as a team-leader/Project Manager as and when needs arise. Contribute to the monthly reporting of project progress Pro-actively stay updated on latest ArcGIS and relevant IT technology  Â
job_requirements: Requirements Minimally 5 years of working experience as a software engineer doing programming. job_descriptions: Engineering at Vungle: The SRE Team at Vungle is a 24/7 operation in charge of maintaining the platform Vungle uses to run production systems. job_descriptions: Engineering at Vungle: The SRE Team at Vungle is a 24/7 operation in charge of maintaining the platform Vungle uses to run production systems. You'll experience a mix of activities from optimizing Kubernetes to maintaining systems uptime, to implementing multi-region and multi-cloud deployments. This role is focused on the maintenance of reliability of the platform & processes and automation of re-occuring tasks. There is plenty of room to learn about the software deployment side of things as well. This is a brand new team at Vungle and we are looking to hire 5 people: 1 manager and 4 team members. Technologies We Use:  AWS, GCP Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins Redis, Mongo, Cassandra, Kafka, MemSQL Golang, Scala, Python, NodeJS Spark, Redshift, ElasticSearch (ELK stack) Datadog, New Relic, Pagerduty  Essential Qualities:  Ability to balance doing things right with fixing things quickly. Flexible and pragmatic, while working towards improving the long-term health of the system. You have a strong systems experience who can also code. You have an analytical approach to identifying problem components based on data points. Reliability of systems & applications is your core passion. The team will be responsible for analyzing systems based on data points to identify workloads that are critical to the business. Comfortable working cross-functionally to ensure success of the systemâs operation. You will be closely collaborating with other engineering and product teams to ensure that expected system behavior is understood and monitoring exists to detect anomalies. You will be called upon to support the stack in the event of a failure. You are comfortable with on-call responsibility and are able to manage a crisis working with the broader team, communicating progress and challenges during the crisis.
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements:  7+ years of experience in a SRE / Systems admin related role with a background in software development Previously managed, mentor and grew a small team Expertise in Linux systems administration Experience with Multi-Cloud Computing (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.) Experience in building tools to automate system maintenance tasks Solid understanding of monitoring tools and ability to define metrics to detect anomalies Hands-on Kubernetes or Docker experience, including deployment tools (spinnaker, istio) Solid understanding of server automation systems (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform) Scripting using any language (GO, NodeJs, Bash, python, etc.) Hands-on experience with datadog, stack driver, cloudwatch, splunk, elk or other log processing & alerting systems Cloud-based networking experience (HaProxy, WAF, Â ELB, ALB, distributed multi-cloud VPC) Fluency in English  Nice to Have:   Understanding of various security standards, protocols and implementation details Previous professional experience writing in Golang, Java, Scala, C or C++ is a plus Experience using & configuring Akamai a plus Passionate about trying emerging technologies Management of a distributed Kafka cluster is a plus Fluency in Mandarin Chinese a plus  Â  NOTE: Resumes submitted directly to Jobsbank will not be responded to quickly. For faster response, please apply directly to vungle.com/careers or send your resume to jennifer.ho@vungle.com and cite Jobsbank as your source.

Those who are prone to seasickness need not apply. There is also overseas travel opportunities for the engineer.Â  This USV technology is the future for the marine industry.Â  Â
